projecttitle: WATER AVAILABILITY AND AGRIC. SYS. DEVEL. IN SINAI PENINSULA
project_descrip: Short: WATER AVAILABILITY AND AGRIC. SYS. DEVEL. IN SINAI PENINSULA Long: The project aims at supplying water for drinking and irrigation purposes, and developing the agricultural system in 15 development compounds, 8 in the north Sinai governorate and 7 in the south Sinai governorate, out of 26 compounds to be established to settle bedouins. These compounds, which will host agricultural and industrial activities, constitute one of the components of the Sinai Peninsula's Development Program
shortdescription: WATER AVAILABILITY AND AGRIC. SYS. DEVEL. IN SINAI PENINSULA
channelreportedname: MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE AND LNAD REFORMS
longdescription: The project aims at supplying water for drinking and irrigation purposes, and developing the agricultural system in 15 development compounds, 8 in the north Sinai governorate and 7 in the south Sinai governorate, out of 26 compounds to be established to settle bedouins. These compounds, which will host agricultural and industrial activities, constitute one of the components of the Sinai Peninsula's Development Program

projecttitle: Establishement of a water System for Bahr El Bakar Drain
project_descrip: Short: THE PROJECT REPRESENTS ONE OF THE MAIN COMPONENTS OF THE SINAI PENINSULA DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM, WHICH AIMS AT IMPROVING CONDITIONS AND ACHIEVING POLITIC Long: The project represents one of the main components of the Sinai Peninsula Development Program, which aims at improving conditions and achieving political and social stability in this area. The project aims at contributing to the development of the Sinai Peninsula through the provision of 5 million m3 daily of treated water for the irrigation of about 330 thousand feddans to produce the appropriate agricultural crops, and construct agro-industrial facilities and barns to raise cattle. This is to be achieved by transporting polluted drainage water from Bahr El Bakar in the west Suez Canal to the east of the canal, and treating it for irrigation purposes.

projecttitle: INTEGRATED DEV. PROJ. IN WADI ARABA (PHASE1)
project_descrip: Short: INTEGRATED DEV. PROJ. IN WADI ARABA (PHASE1) Long: The project aims at reducing poverty and unemployment, and providing permanent residence for the population of Wadi Araba region, by creating small irrigation projects, developing agricultural and animal resources, and supporting related activities. The project also aims at improving the living standards for the inhabitants of the region by developing public utilities, improving health and education services and supporting local activities. This project constitutes the first phase of a comprehensive program aimed at transforming the region from a poor, low-density population area, to one that attracts people and different economic activities, through the utilization of the natural resources available locally.
shortdescription: INTEGRATED DEV. PROJ. IN WADI ARABA (PHASE1)
channelreportedname: AQABA SPECIAL ECONOMIC ZONE AUTHORITY
longdescription: The project aims at reducing poverty and unemployment, and providing permanent residence for the population of Wadi Araba region, by creating small irrigation projects, developing agricultural and animal resources, and supporting related activities. The project also aims at improving the living standards for the inhabitants of the region by developing public utilities, improving health and education services and supporting local activities. This project constitutes the first phase of a comprehensive program aimed at transforming the region from a poor, low-density population area, to one that attracts people and different economic activities, through the utilization of the natural resources available locally.

projecttitle: ASSAIDA AND KULLA KUBRA DAMS AND WATER TRANSFER
project_descrip: Short: ASSAIDA AND KULLA KUBRA DAMS AND WATER TRANSFER Long: The project aims at covering the expected deficit in drinking water of Grand Tunis (Tunis, Ariana, Ben Arous and Manouba Provinces), the Sahel (Sousse, Monastir and Mahdia Provinces) and the Cap Bon (Nabeul Province) regions, and meeting their need for water up to the year 2030. The project also aims at reducing the existing deficit in drinking water in Sfax province, through the storage of part of the water from the upper northern region of the country in the Saida and Kalaa Kebira dams, and its conveyance to the water treatment plants. The project will contribute to the provision of additional amounts of water for irrigation purposes in the Cap Bon, secure a drinking water reserve for the regions benefiting from the project, and also contribute to the reduction of the salinity of the water that is distributed and to the reduction in the depletion of groundwater resources currently used.
shortdescription: ASSAIDA AND KULLA KUBRA DAMS AND WATER TRANSFER
channelreportedname: Ministry of Agriculture, Water Resources and Fisheries
longdescription: The project aims at covering the expected deficit in drinking water of Grand Tunis (Tunis, Ariana, Ben Arous and Manouba Provinces), the Sahel (Sousse, Monastir and Mahdia Provinces) and the Cap Bon (Nabeul Province) regions, and meeting their need for water up to the year 2030. The project also aims at reducing the existing deficit in drinking water in Sfax province, through the storage of part of the water from the upper northern region of the country in the Saida and Kalaa Kebira dams, and its conveyance to the water treatment plants. The project will contribute to the provision of additional amounts of water for irrigation purposes in the Cap Bon, secure a drinking water reserve for the regions benefiting from the project, and also contribute to the reduction of the salinity of the water that is distributed and to the reduction in the depletion of groundwater resources currently used.

project_descrip: Short: THE PROJECT, WHICH IS EXPECTED TO BE COMPLETED IN THE SECOND QUARTER OF 2024, CONSISTS OF THE CONSTRUCTION OF TASA DAM AND ITS APPURTENANT STRUCTURES Long: The project, which is expected to be completed in the second quarter of 2024, consists of the construction of Tasa dam and its appurtenant structures in El Kef governorate, and Khallad dam and its appurtenant structures in Baja governorate, as well as the technical services necessary to implement the project. The project also includes the expropriation of land necessary for its implementation and operation, in addition to project management.
shortdescription: THE PROJECT, WHICH IS EXPECTED TO BE COMPLETED IN THE SECOND QUARTER OF 2024, CONSISTS OF THE CONSTRUCTION OF TASA DAM AND ITS APPURTENANT STRUCTURES
channelreportedname: Ministry of Agriculture, Water Resources and Fisheries
longdescription: The project, which is expected to be completed in the second quarter of 2024, consists of the construction of Tasa dam and its appurtenant structures in El Kef governorate, and Khallad dam and its appurtenant structures in Baja governorate, as well as the technical services necessary to implement the project. The project also includes the expropriation of land necessary for its implementation and operation, in addition to project management.

projecttitle: PROTECTION OF SANAA CITY FROM FLOODS
project_descrip: Short: PROTECTION OF SANAA CITY FROM FLOODS Long: The project aims at protecting the population, buildings, shops and infrastructure in Al Sabeen and Shoob areas in Sana'a city from potential damages caused by heavy floods. This will contribute to improving the conditions of the citizens and lands adjacent to the Wadi, as well as enhancing the city planning and landscape. The project also aims at collecting flood water for different purposes, such as irrigation and groundwater recharge
shortdescription: PROTECTION OF SANAA CITY FROM FLOODS
channelreportedname: CAPITAL SECERTARIATE - SANA'A
longdescription: The project aims at protecting the population, buildings, shops and infrastructure in Al Sabeen and Shoob areas in Sana'a city from potential damages caused by heavy floods. This will contribute to improving the conditions of the citizens and lands adjacent to the Wadi, as well as enhancing the city planning and landscape. The project also aims at collecting flood water for different purposes, such as irrigation and groundwater recharge
